channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go backs 2020 as Year of Filipino Health Workers
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has expressed support for the Department of Health call to declare 2020 as the “Year of Filipino Health Workers” as the country continues to fight the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: NAIA to resume international operations tomorrow
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: The Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3 is set to accept arriving and departing international passengers tomorrow, after it was closed last March 28 due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: New PNP-AFP body to enhance operations, identify lapses
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: A joint board of inquiry of the police and military will be created to enhance the operational procedures of government troops after policemen shot dead four Army soldiers in Jolo, Sulu last week, according to Philippine National Police chief Gen. Archie Gamboa.

item.title: DTI backs sin products online sale ban if…
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Department of Trade and Industry is supporting a move to ban the sale of cigarettes and liquor by unregistered online sellers.

item.title: Palace: Anti-terror law not anti-Muslim
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang yesterday allayed fears that the controversial Anti-Terrorism Act would discriminate against Muslims, saying only terrorists should be afraid of the measure.

item.title: SC receives multiple petitions vs terror law
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: More groups and individuals have sought the help of the Supreme Court in stopping the implementation of the Anti-Terrorism Act, which President Duterte signed last Friday.

item.title: Meralco apologizes for bill shock
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Manila Electric Co. has apologized for the so-called “bill shock” as it assured customers that the P47 convenience fee for online payments will be waived, aside from a swift refund for any overcharging.

item.title: Duterte emotional, not ill – Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte’s seemingly weak appearance during his visit to Zamboanga City last week was not health-related but caused by an “emotional issue” following the death of four soldiers at the hands of police in Sulu, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: ‘Metro Manila not running out of hospital beds’
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Malacañang described as “fake news” yesterday reports that Metro Manila’s healthcare system was under severe strain amid the recent spike in coronavirus cases.

item.title: Palace: No discrimination against Muslims under Anti-Terrorism Law
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: "The president won't allow class legislation against Muslims. Why? The president has a Muslim blood. His grandmother is a Tausug," Roque added.
